alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Franklin; Hart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued October 06 at 2:49PM EDT until October 07 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FRANKLIN, HART, AND ELBERT COUNTIES... * AFFECTED AREA...Franklin, Hart and Elbert Counties in Georgia. * TIMING...Late Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 20 mph. Gusts as high as 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds, dry air, and very dryvegetation due to the lack of recent rainfall will create favorable conditions for the rapid spread of wildfire. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
